headline.main: LATEST SUFFOLK CURB EFFORT: CIGARETTE BILL

docs.lead_paragraph: SUFFOLK COUNTY, perhaps the only place whose residents used to smuggle in bootleg laundry detergent, is considering yet another prohibition. This time it's the cigarette. The proposed ban is the latest in a long line of attempts by the County Legislature to outlaw or severely limit a great number of things. In recent years, the County Legislators have tried to curb the use not only of laundry detergents but also of X-rated video games, throwaway beer bottles and soda cans, microwave ovens, polyurethane and latex foam furniture, potato bug killers, cesspool cleaners and 700 forms of poisonous plants, including the daffodil bulb.
